name: Thepla
history: Thepla is a traditional Gujarati flatbread, beloved for its delicious taste and ease of preparation. Originating from the western Indian state of Gujarat, it has become popular across the country for its versatility and flavor.
description: Thepla is a soft, thin flatbread made from whole wheat flour, gram flour, and often includes fenugreek leaves. Seasoned with spices like turmeric and chili powder, Theplas are cooked on a griddle and served with pickles, yogurt, or chutneys.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a bowl, mix whole wheat flour, gram flour, chopped methi leaves, turmeric powder, red chili powder, salt, and oil. Gradually add water (and yogurt, if using) and knead into a soft dough.

instructions.title: Roll and Cook the Theplas
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Roll each ball into a thin circle. Cook on a hot griddle, applying oil on both sides, until brown spots appear.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the hot theplas with pickles, curd, or any curry of your choice.

tips: The dough should be soft and non-sticky for easy rolling.
Cook on medium heat to ensure even cooking and to retain softness.
variations: Substitute methi with other greens like spinach or dill for a different flavor.
Add spices like cumin seeds or ajwain for an extra zing.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh but can be stored in an airtight container for up to 24 hours.
storage.instructions: Reheat on a griddle before serving if stored.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a hot griddle or tawa until warm and soft.
presentationTips: Serve on a colorful platter with a side of fresh salad or raita.
Garnish with butter or ghee for a richer flavor.
